website_summaries.verdict: These retro gamepads are an inexpensive blast from the past that work with a wide range of retrogaming systems and emulators.
pros: Works with a number of retrogaming operating systems such as RetroPie, Lakka, and ChameleonPi
For Windows 98 through 10, as well as some Linux installs and Mac OS X
Comes with two controllers to a pack
Nice look at a low price
cons: At just 5 feet in length, the cords could be longer (plan on getting USB cord extensions)
Some thought the controllers felt cheap

customer_reviews.title: Defective(resolved)
customer_reviews.text: I mean yea they work I guess, but I’ve had mine for less than 2 weeks and the wire cover has already pulled out of the controller exposing the wires. See picture *update* I was since emailed directly by the manufacturer and they apologized for any defective items. They are sending me 2 more controllers for the inconvenience. Great customer service, happy that they take pride in their products. Update 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: djb123

customer_reviews.title: better than Ibuffalo for half the price
customer_reviews.text: These controllers are dope. Wall jumping in Super metroid is a breeze. concave X and Y buttons. Rubber start and select buttons. Smooth Dpad, up and down inputs don't get mixed wth left and right inputs like most cheap end controllers. If you've got a Retropie setup going, these are absolutely the controllers for you. The only minor downside is the relatively short cords, which are in fact 5 feet as labeled in the description. i would recommend a USB extensions cord. Thank you iNNEXT!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Manring

customer_reviews.title: Great controllers for the price, black with colored buttons looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the controllers and iNNEXT personally emailed me to resolve it. The controllers are great for playing classic games. especially those looking to extend their controllers to multiplayer sessions. These work great for Genesis, SNES, NES, and Gameboy games, and any handheld gaming machine up to the DS on emulation. Great for the price, don't expect original SNES quality (obviously), but they ar definitely comfortable and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Have been working flawlessly for 5 months now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in October 2019. I was a little weary given their low price and all the various similar knockoffs on Amazon. But I figured for $10, it's not a terrible amount to lose if they don't work. I am happy to report that they have worked great! When I first got them, I was a little concerned that one of the buttons seemed a bit loose, but it hasn't been a problem. They were truly plug & play in Windows 10. And zero configuration needed with the MESEN emulator. I have zero concerns recommending these to other people! In fact, I already have on numerous occasions!
customer_reviews.author: Evolution2001

customer_reviews.title: The hardware is nice, but there are a few problems with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is nice, but there are a few problems with the electronics. (1) The buttons are assigned weird ids, so you need to remap them on your computer. This is true for Windows or Raspberry Pi. (2) The USB polling interval is set to 50 ms, which means they have much higher lag than a normal controller.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Gonna be a no from me dawg....
customer_reviews.text: Even for $11 I don't think these are worth it Both of mine have ghost diagonal inputs when pressing left not as bad as most I've tried and could ALMOST look past and work with it but HOLY MOLY those shoulder buttons are the hardest mushy triggers on any controller I've ever used! They're very crisp in the middle but the force required for it to break is to the extreme. Face buttons I would give a 4/5 I personally don't like this much wobble but its similar to some famicom ones I've used and is very very usable. Looking for a more inexpensive controller since I burn through them every 3-4 months but unfortunately that search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for a great price - exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: You know, I bought these simply to use as a menu controller in my arcade cabinets I'm building. I hide them in behind the coin door so I can get to the service menu and TAB menu in MAME. So I bought the pair for $10 with the hope they would just serve as what I intended. These controllers are actually quite nice, I haven't and probably won't use them a lot, but they fell solid like an original controller and the buttons seem to have the same great feel from the 90s I remember. So if I did want a usb style 90s controller like this, I would buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin DeVane

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Shows up as a generic gamepad to most PCs. Other than that it's pretty good for the price. Wish I could've got the nostalgic grey but I like the black ones too. Its pretty cheap feeling but super Nintendo controllers have always been that way too. Only tested one so far but it could of course be configured for emulation but I launched the game Move or Die and it couldn't be found. So bare in mind it wont work for all games unless you bind it with keystrokes with a program like joy2key. Worth the buy. My son is 3 and could never play games with us because his hands are small. Good solution for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ruk ryce

customer_reviews.title: With a little modding, these are excellent!
customer_reviews.text: These controllers are pretty good. They are made of high quality plastic and feels about the same strength and weight as an original SNES controller. However, if you buy a high quality replacement SNES D-pad (or better yet, have some old beat up SNES controllers lying around to swap parts from like I did) these become almost perfect! The only improvement that can be made beyond the D-pad is the texture of the controller... it's really smooth where the original SNES controller has a nice textured feel. With a little modding they feel 99% like the real thing though, it's close enough!
customer_reviews.author: J. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to buy in bulk and giveaway!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lot of these for my wedding guests... I had some retro games running and made sure people took whatever them home because I didn't need a pile of inexpensive USB SNES controllers. People who are very picky will notice that the buttons are a bit more firm to press and don't have the same plunge depth as the original controllers. However, most regular people haven't touched an SNES controller since the 1990s (or at all), so they won't be able to tell. None of them have broken yet!
customer_reviews.author: Buzzer

customer_reviews.title: Great controllers for the price with only one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the controllers, they feel better than what you would expect for such a low price. And they function spot on in comparison with the original controllers. The only real problem with them however is the length. They needed to be another few feet longer in order to not sit pretty much inside your TV. The description states the length though so it's not deceiving, just keep in mind that you will be a lot more comfortable if you use extenders. Lastly these hooked up and worked flawlessly with my Raspberry Pi 3 B+ (Retro Pie).
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Money better spent elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a bad controller, just a minor issue that make it annoying to use. The D-pad is too sensitive to inputs. When I say this, I mean if you press down, with just the slightest left or right bias, it will detect the bias as intended input. I’ve got controllers from various eras, all the way back to the original Gravis USB gamepad pro. None are nearly as sensitive to this as the innext controller. This makes games like Super Mario 3 or Super Metroid extremely difficult to play. I find the size of the controller and button feel otherwise good. That’s what keeps this controller from getting one star.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: so bottom line is they work. they are shaped very close to original SNES controllers. I don't like the fact that if you want them to look like a Nintendo controller, you have to pay more money ( ie: color scheme ), I order the black with colored buttons to save money. I am specifically using these on the Retro bit Super retro-cade system, because these actually have the correct button mapping. I have tried Better Built controllers but unfortunately the buttons are reversed and you cannot correct them. hopefully these will last quite a while with excessive use and hard button mashing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon N.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feel, but durability issues
customer_reviews.text: These are great controllers, especially for the price. Can confirm: feels very much like a SNES controller when new. Not particularly durable, though. The pad underneath the B button on both controllers has lost some of its elasticity. On one of them, it doesn't register pressing precisely anymore. I got a year out of two playing through games that need a *lot* of B-mashing: Earthbound, Xenogears (the cutscenes, ugh), Super Mario World, Castlevania, Mega Man, and Zelda. So I got some use out of them. Just don't expect them to last forever. Overall, a good product if you're realistic about what you're buying.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: SNES clone that works for pi
customer_reviews.text: The controller box was different that the package i received, but the pic did match up. Maybe it was a return? I dont know. I did test it and was able to Hadoken and Shoryuken okay with them. I did mess up Zangiefs Full throws on the D pad, so its not the BEST in the world. If youre looking for a controller that you can do quarter cricle forwards and z motions, this one would work, esp for a pi. But dont expect to use throw characters well.
customer_reviews.author: トミー

customer_reviews.title: Shame, they didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: These looked perfect for what I ordered them for. Arcade style controllers for arcade games for my son and I. They are a good size for my son and for the price you can’t complain. But that is where the praise stops. At first barely recognized on my PC though I resolved that issue. But the controller didn’t function in any of my games. Well I got some button functionality but not enough to play the game. The games only required basic functionality. But no joy, so they’re heading back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: One works, one DOA
customer_reviews.text: Didn't use these right away after buying and one is DOA out of the box. Return window is closed. You get what you pay for I guess. I'm getting a device descriptor read error when I connect it. [3012710.998173] usb 1-1.1: new low-speed USB device number 14 using ehci-pci [3012711.070170] usb 1-1.1: device descriptor read/64, error -32 [3012711.246169] usb 1-1.1: device descriptor read/64, error -32
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nathan J. Wray

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I got these to connect to my Raspberry Pi emulating NES, SNES, SEGA Master System, GENESIS, Atari 2600, and very other ports. Worked perfect out of the box. Brings back that retro feel from when I was a 10 year old kid playing on my Super Nintendo living in government subsidized housing worrying if the drug dealer neighbor was going to have another fight with another nightwalker circa Houston, Texas 1998.
customer_reviews.author: bong95

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working
customer_reviews.text: These controllers were literally delivered an hour ago. I was able to configure them, and they worked for a short while, but they keep disconnecting. Then, one of them only had one button work and it wasn't even the right button that had been configured. I'm incredibly frustrated because it's a rainy day here in Portland and my son and I had planned on playing video games together! I need a resolution
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: These aren't great controllers, they are lighter and not as good as a real SNES controller. The build quality is questionable, and the buttons require mashing them in order to ensure they function. I also get a much more of a delay with these controllers vs others we have tried, so they make playing a lot of older games too challenging. They are okay for very occasional use, but I would not recommend them for anyone who is seriously interested in a true console controller feel.
customer_reviews.author: Random Human

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: In less than 2 months of occasional use, the controller is no longer recognized by Windows. My best guess is that a connection came loose. Edit: Second controller just failed too, within days of writing the initial review. That one was barely used at all. It's like these things are set to self-destruct after 2 months. I contacted iNNEXT and they're sending me a new one. But at this point I have no expectation that it will last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Janus

customer_reviews.title: you should probably look for a better build quality.
customer_reviews.text: They are very cheaply made. The wire is constantly pulling out of the top of the controller leaving the wires inside exposed. The colored face buttons are to far apart and the D-pad is not very responsive. Update: The company contacted me and offered to replace with the updated version which is: [Newest Version] iNNEXT SNES Retro USB Super Nintendo Controller Gamepad Joystick, USB PC Controller Joypad Gamestick, Raspberry Pi Controller for Windows PC / MAC / Raspberry Pi (Pack of 2) Has a weird square shape and feels a little clunky in the hands but the build quality is a huge improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Gambit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome RetroPie Controllers
customer_reviews.text: We have a RetroPie machine to run various game ROMS and these controllers are absolutely perfect for old school NES and Super NES games. The buttons are very responsive and comfortable to use. We have put many hours of gaming on these and they have held up nicely. The only complaint I have is with the length of the cord. If it were 3-4 feet longer that would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price a little sticky
customer_reviews.text: Good -They feel like an snes controller, retro arch* detects them no need to map buttons Bad- the buttons on the direction pad sometimes stick and Mario will randomly dart into a hole, koopa trooper etc. I'm hoping they break in a little. The cords could be a little longer I needed to order extensions. *Neutral- don't bother trying to get these to play Android apps on a Chromebook, Chrome OS will not recognize them at this time no matter how long you try. If you need a controller for a Chromebook stick to the controllers that are known to work.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR DREDGING UP THOSE OLD FEELINGS!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gaming console of all time was the SNES! Mine died around 6 years ago and I have missed having it around. With these controllers and an emulator, I have it all again! These work flawlessly! They are the exact dimensions of the original SNES controller and feel perfect! Everyone that wants to play SNES games and get the whole experience needs to get these controllers!! Perfect! The 4 on the Ergonomics of the controller reflect on the Original controllers, because well, lets face it, they aren't ergonomic at all. But I still love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Roy Welch

customer_reviews.title: The Nostalgia is real and these controllers work great
customer_reviews.text: I have these hooked up to my Raspberry Pi and they work wonderfully to play the old SNES games. Controller hooked up with no issues, easy to program and the response from the buttons reminds me of the original SNES controllers. Con: I think the controller cord is way to short. I don't like having to sit on top of my television to play it and that feels like the case with this. I'll just add a USB extension but figured I'd warn you.
customer_reviews.author: Stuck

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these and the N64 version from the same brand. The quality of these controllers is amazing for this price. They are the right size and they look and feel very close to the Super Nintendo controllers they are emulating. (I still have my SNES controllers, so I was not just comparing from memory). The buttons work well and the durability seems good. The only difference in the feel of these controllers is that they are lighter than the originals, which hasn't bothered me any. I like them very much
customer_reviews.author: Lucas DJG

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: They are nice controllers. I’d love to have seen longer cords since we don’t have 19inch CRT televisions anymore and I think the average gamer sits farther away from their tv than they used to. Nothing that can’t be fixed with a USB extension, though. They claim to be Retropie comparable, and for the most part, that is true. However, they lack a home button that makes some of the functionality more challenging. They do work, though. From what I remember they are very much like the originals. It’s been a long time, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Luther

customer_reviews.title: For the price this cannot be beat
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quick replacement after my favorite controller crapped out so I ordered these as a fast replacement until I can find another 'Excalibur' (which is what I called my old controller that lasted over 10 years). For the price these were much better than I expected! I would put them on par with the original SNES controllers in quality and feel. Much much much better than I expected and an amazing deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Polybius

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish are pretty good. I have beaten Megaman X with them and played SF Alpha 3 up to shin Akuma as well. The color scheme is nice, I wanted the SFC button colors with the SNES concave buttons on top, there woulda been perfect if gray. I love that you get 2 of them for the low price. Using a braided USB Extension on them with no issues on my retro pi 3b+ I want to try a few other brands before I give this 5 stars but if you cant afford to test around, just get these, they work and are 99% accurate.
customer_reviews.author: News

customer_reviews.title: Great, but 1 flaw
customer_reviews.text: The controllers feel great, just like the old SNES controllers. The buttons are responsive and I had no issues getting it to work in my Raspberry Pi. However, nothing secures the wire where it connects with the controller. After an hour if use, the wire pulled loose exposing the inner wires. I attempted to super glue them in place, but it didn't last more than a week of light use. The controllers are still useable, but at some point that loose wire is going to fail. Overall, great price and good controllers, but I'll have to buy something soon to replace them when that loose wire finally fails and I'll likely look at another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Buttons wear out after one or two uses
customer_reviews.text: I got these to let my kids relive my past in playing old ROMs on the PC. The B button on the controller must have been defective because it wore out after like one or two uses. I have now have to press the button really hard in order for it to work. I didn't even give these to my kids since the buttons don't work so what's the point? I am giving two stars instead of one because the plug and play-ability was really good and easy to configure on emulators. But without the proper buttons working, the game play is spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the previous version of this 2 pack in 2017 for a Retropie. They worked fine for the first couple of months, though the buttons were a bit flimsy and construction felt cheap. Then one day a gamepad did not connect to the Pi. A few days later the second gamepad stopped connecting as well. Other gamepads connect fine and I tried to connect these to other devices with no luck. Prior to that, I was using it moderately with no button mashing, it just stopped working out of the blue. Based on the reviews here, the newer controllers may have better construction, but I'm a bit wary of that.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Rofman

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had a nostalgic attack when I unboxed the package, was very happy to see a controller nearly as close as the original. BUT, after testing the controllers I noticed that one of the controller was faulty, the L button was keep it pressed, I opened thinking that maybe the rubber of the button was faulty, but no, it seems that the piece of the circuit IS faulty, so I disconnect the wire from the circuit and everything go "normal", but with one button left. I didn't return because I can't, the shipping cost would be more expensive that keeping the controllers. I hope the other buttons last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good feel to the controllers & amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: <--UPDATE--> the seller contacted me shortly after posting my previous review, and kindly offered to replace both controllers (even though only one was bad) and rush shipped me 2 controllers which were actually a newer model than what I originally purchased. Extremely pleased and pleasantly surprised with the customer service, and will most definitely be a return customer! <--Update--> Good feel to the controllers, but after 3 days the Up arrow on one controller stopped working, and it stops working from time to time and the B button wont work at random times. But the 2nd controller works great and I haven't had any trouble with that one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert bulthuis

customer_reviews.title: Solid Controllers, Solid Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a two pack and one of the controllers was defective. I had posted a review stating the controllers were awesome with a 3 star review but the customer support team reached out to me to see how to make it right. After explaining the issue more in depth, we realized I had a fluke controller and they quickly sent out another two pack, of which BOTH worked perfect. The grip of the controller is really good. The buttons feel tight and responsive. This is a great product made by really great compassionate people. I hope anybody looking for an SNES styled retro controller tries them out.
customer_reviews.author: colesloth

customer_reviews.title: Great for Retropie Budget Build
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of the black SNES style controllers and returned them because of the poor quality. I was contacted by the seller and offered the new and improved model. They sent me one to test for free. I was surprised, these are nothing like the older units. The button presses are not mushy, they nice and tight. The buttons and d-pad do not rattle when you shake the unit. I have a couple hours of Mario, punch out, and various other games played on it and it's held up nicely. This new model rivals the quality of the Ibuffalo. If you are considering a budget Retropie build this is the controller to buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Well worth buying
customer_reviews.text: These controllers are great! I have used both for about a week or two now and they show no signs of issues. They are very light weight, but so were the original SNES controllers back when they came out. These feel just like them. I've bought generic controllers before that were disappointing, particularly the PS3 ones. These are fantastic and well worth the price. The only issue I have is that the cords are a little short. If you're not close to the computer, you'll probably need a USB extension cable, like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: they feel pretty good, not just like the real thing but ...
customer_reviews.text: got these to use with a raspberry pi with emulation station. they feel pretty good, not just like the real thing but close. the problem is that one didn't work. It was extremely unresponsive with the pi and with windows, it kept malfunctioning and disconnecting. Its a shame that there aren't any good alternatives to these on amazon. just know that if you buy these, you might have to return them until you get lucky and get a good pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with RetroPi, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with a RetroPi, which they worked with out of the box (as expected). That said, they're cheaply made, and sometimes the d-pad is a bit wonky, and the buttons generally feel flimsy. If you plan to use your controllers a lot, especially if you've got good competition in a fighting game, you probably want to spend a little more. Overall, good value for money, it's just that it's not enough money to get quality that approaches the original controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Myer

customer_reviews.title: Great Controlelrs for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great Controllers for the price, Solid construction. My only qualm would be the weight. They are so light, it feels weird to hold when compared to the original SNES controllers. Also, when using a 6 foot USB 2 Extension cable, there is a ever so slight latency. I can't 100% blame that on the controller, but if you want to use a USB extender cable to increase the cable length, just keep that in mind. Still, you get 2 controllers for a great price. I use these to Play SNES games NES games. I would buy from iNNEXT again for a different style controller based on my experience with these.
customer_reviews.author: nosajmunson

customer_reviews.title: I carefully read the reviews to see if they were going to be good enough, or if I should just spend a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these controls to use with my RetroPie to play old NES, SNES, and other old video games. I carefully read the reviews to see if they were going to be good enough, or if I should just spend a little bit more and go with a different control. Needless to say the overall reviews were good, but mine have not lived up to the same standard. there seems to be delay in the buttons and D-pad, particularly the A button and the left direction. I would not recommend these if you are looking to enjoy some old classics.
customer_reviews.author: mb1134

customer_reviews.title: Maybe try another brand.....
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this review low stars for two reasons, this was an amazon choice selection and both don’t work. They were inexpensive, but I don’t just want to burn money either, just looking for a deal. Yes, they came on time, yes the package came as described. But they don’t work and I ordered two in the event one came and didn’t work. Looks like I struck out. Stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. D-Pad often misfires.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something with retropie. The construction feels fine but the dpad misfires...a lot. I did this on both of them so I don't think this was a fluke. The d pad misfired multiple times. Was pressing left and it registered as UP. At first I just though I made a mistake but it kept happening.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fath

customer_reviews.title: I use these for my Commodore 64 mini, they are perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy these controllers based on some reviews on the quality, but I am sure glad I did end up making the purchase! Super good deal, you get two, and they work exactly as I hoped. I don't think the quality of the buttons or controller shell feels cheap. It plays really well as a joystick replacement for my C64 mini.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: seemed ok but did not work on my Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so we could play arcade games on my Tesla Model 3. The car did not recognize the controllers when I plugged them in, so I had to return them. It's too bad, I like the small "classic" form factor.
customer_reviews.author: MrPinrel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Steam!
customer_reviews.text: It clearly says"Supported Platform: Steam (Not Support all games. Perfect for Several simple steam games)" But it does NOT work with Steam at all. After much looking on the internet it appears that Steam does not support SNES retro style controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Exitmult

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with RetroPie
customer_reviews.text: I got these as an interim solution to use with my RetroPie until I have all of the components to build my cabinet. They work well and I haven't had any notable issues with them. It is worth noting that they do feel a little flimsy in hand, but I haven't noticed any durability issues with them yet. I'll update if I experience any. For the price, I don't think these can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: CBeck09

customer_reviews.title: Not 5ft Cables
customer_reviews.text: These are decent controllers but the biggest drawback is the cable length. The cables are not 5ft as stated in the description. From the tip of the usb to the bottom of the controller doesn't even measure 5ft. Even so, I doubt 6ft cables would make sitting directly in front my 47" any better. It's just too close for comfort imo. I've only tested them briefly and encountered a few button sticks. We'll see if they get any better.
customer_reviews.author: AlmightyHeretic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Buy but No Clear Direction For Setup
customer_reviews.text: It's all you need for gaming emulators however it took me quite awhile to figure out how to connect them. It is not plug in and play but to save anyone buying these time and stress. Under your emulator settings you just change the configuration to multiplayers (up to 5) and also set the controllers to player 3 and 4. Have had no issues after that w any games ive played.
customer_reviews.author: Pokey_Poke

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work With Most Android Emulators
customer_reviews.text: Tried these with a number of popular emulators on Android, including Retroarch, My Boy, NostalgiaNES, and Neo Emu, and for whatever reason none of them recognize the X, Y, L, or R buttons. This is a shame because the controller is amazingly priced and feels rather good in the hand, but since my tablet has become my go-to retro-gaming console these don't suit my needs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price, but noticed that the wire sheath on one of the controllers is pulling away leaving the underlying exposed wires. After making a 3 star review due to the issue, I was immediately contacted by the seller to remedy the situation. I understand that there are sometimes manufacturing defects, and the seller worked to get the product replaced without issue. Revising this to a 5 star experience. Appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great controller for RetroPie
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with a RetorPie build. They feel like the original controllers to me, but its been a looonng time since I've used a real one. I'm building up a couple RetroPie systems for xmas for my kids/grand-kids, and considering these as they are working well, the price is right, and I prefer the wired controllers as no need to worry about recharging. They are plug and play with the RetroPie.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd set of SNES usb controllers we have purchased. The first set was a grey cheap set - the biggest problem they had was the cord pulled out - they broke. Purchased a "quality" Buffalo SNES controller and it worked fine, until it took a spill from the couch edge to the wood floor - no longer responsive at all. These are holding up well so far and feel as good or better than the Buffalo controller during gameplay. Used with an rpi3/retropie.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works well, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the one I had for Raspberry Pi entertainment sys. NES. So far very pleased with light weight-cord could be longer. Loving it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Alex

customer_reviews.title: They worked great when I got them in September
customer_reviews.text: They worked great when I got them in September. However, one stopped working about a month later and about two weeks ago the second one stopped working. Pretty disappointing. So 2.5 months and Im out 20 dollars. Edit: The company contacted me and sent me to new controllers. Both are working great. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: morgan ghetti

customer_reviews.title: Cord length is SO SHORT
customer_reviews.text: I like these controllers except the cords are so painfully short, I have to sit no more than 3-ish feet away from my TV. That alone pretty much ruins the whole experience I don't want to face to buy some USB extension to enjoy this properly. Otherwise the button layout, responsiveness, etc is fine..
customer_reviews.author: DJF

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I wanted to controllers for my computer. (I have SNES ROMS) Overall the build quality isn't bad. the only complaint I have is that the buttons are a bit mushy. I cannot tell you if they will last, at the moment they are holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneweaver28

customer_reviews.title: 100 percent skip!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE! Does not work, no tech support number, no web site, no email. I have two USB paper weights that aren't even heavy enough to weigh down paper. DO NOT BUY THESE! The reviews that say they received controllers that didn't work but the company fixed the problem must be fake, because there is no contact information to complain to. DO NOT BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Higheyecue

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the single USB controller buy a backup for a couple $ more. Maybe other people got a bad controller or something because these feel tougher than the old controllers. My buttons didn't stick or anything either. When it comes to buying a N64 USB controller soon I will use the same Manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: retropie snes, great experience
customer_reviews.text: Works like a mou fuggin monster, currently using for a retropie with only snes games. No issues, kids like to play it with dirty greesy fingers and there still has been no issues with them. Well built and good quality. Based on the compared prices of other controllers these things are amazing. They do not exactly fit that vintage look, but honestly when they came out with the black cartridge for Killer Instinct back in the day I was super hyped. This is kind of reminiscent of that for me so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good dpad, but mushy shoulder buttons and action buttons are too high
customer_reviews.text: I first I thought the dpad was no good, but turns out it pretty solid. The controller worked wonderfully with retrobox with precise input, no lag, and no ghost inputs like my ibuffalos. The shoulder buttons are mushy and the action buttons are too high, but have a nice click to them. If they fixed the shoulder buttons I could forgive the action button issue and would give it a 4.5. if they fixed both issues it would be easily be worth a few bucks more and I would give it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: mindzoid

customer_reviews.title: Good controllers
customer_reviews.text: These are great, cheap controllers. They actually lasted longer than expected, after about 7-8 months one of the conrtollers cables just stopped working. Moving the cable temporarily fixed the problem but it would quickly disconnect. If iNNEXT reads this, love the controllers, felt great. Just use a slightly better quality of cable. USB cables can be a bit fragile if the cable sheathe is too stiff. Otherwise great product. Im definitely going to get more
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Block

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because the Xbox controller wasn't ideal for playing Link to the Past. It works great, and despite warnings that drivers might be needed, the controller was plug-and-play, which made me quite happy. Price is great, and it works well with emulators.
customer_reviews.author: L. H.

customer_reviews.title: I needed a pair of controllers for my retropie and these works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the search for some cheap controllers for my retropie and found these. glad I ordered these. They worked out of the box without any issues and its been working since I ordered them. They feel good and the cord has enough length for me, but if you need a longer cable then just buy a extension cable and they will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gokou

customer_reviews.title: Cheap controller, works decent.
customer_reviews.text: There isnt much to say about this controller other than the fact that everything about it is cheap feeling and just below average. I would not go as far as to say that they are unusable. I use these pretty regularly and they work well enough but t just feels like they are cheap. If you dont care about quality in your controller, then this is a fine pick, but these are not a replacement for the official controllers or even an 8bitdo controller of the same style.
customer_reviews.author: bret smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality and functions? it's a 4 BUT for the money?? A Definite 5
customer_reviews.text: The controllers work very well. Not the most responsive or best quality made but for the money, these are amazing. I currently am using these for my Batocera setup without issues. Cord length is good too at around 5 feet.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Both controllers I received are defective. They both react ...
customer_reviews.text: Both controllers I received are defective. They both react as if the Left D-Pad is continuously pressed, despite otherwise. Should have headed the advice of some of the other reviewers and steer clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: LittleJoe

customer_reviews.title: Works good in retropie
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be made of decent/good quality, no concerns so far. Cord is a bit short (5 ft) so you might need an extender if you want to sit further away. Plugged this into my Retropie system and it was immediately recognized and worked out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tolzy

customer_reviews.title: These so far have worked great, just had to readjust a game or two ...
customer_reviews.text: These so far have worked great, just had to readjust a game or two but its the norm when ya use a new controller, the buttons are very reactive and I have had no issues yet with deadzones. I am planning on building my own home nes system with a raspberry pi. and these will be perfect so when the grandkids come over they can play this, since I am not paying 200+ for a new nes.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bill

customer_reviews.title: Wire's out of controller.
customer_reviews.text: As much as i want to give this 5 stars it gets 4 stars because after just 4 days of minimal usage (setting up a raspberry Pi) one of the cords has come out from inside of the controller exposing the coated color wiring, If it wasn't for the wire problem these are some of the best controllers you can buy for the price range! Brought me back to my childhood for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Harkins

customer_reviews.title: I do not know why these were recommended on the same page that purchasing the re-distributed Super ...
customer_reviews.text: Controllers are great USB to PC game controllers... DO NOT BUY FOR NINTENDO SNES!!!!! I do not know why these were recommended on the same page that purchasing the re-distributed Super NES Classic by Nintendo was, because they DO NOT WORK ON THAT UNIT. I kept them because they work fine on my home PC with my home-brew Game-Maker games tho.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: cheap but fine
customer_reviews.text: decent quality overall, one controller has a loose cable where you can pull it out of the controller housing and see the individual wires which could lead to failure. works fine regardless howeverq
customer_reviews.author: Jason olsen

customer_reviews.title: The best controller design from the 16-bit era!
customer_reviews.text: Plug n Play. Works like a charm. One of the best controller designs ever!
customer_reviews.author: Phonsomchay

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, the USB connection is fragile...
customer_reviews.text: I love the design, feel, and weight of these controllers. However, the USB connection is no longer functional on one of the controllers. It's a shame because my wife and I were really enjoying using these gamepads. For some background, I have a laptop with Debian Mint OS and installed RetroPie on it. We primarily played SNES games(Tetris, Super Mario World, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Controller
customer_reviews.text: I use mine for my computer, and gifted this purchase to a family member. So far it has held up well to their use. It's comfortable and definitely reminiscent of a SNES controller.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Auto jump moving right
customer_reviews.text: All buttons work great but as some of the comment says, the controller pad has a problem when walking to the right arrow. It just jumps forward (in fighting games) like if you were pressing UP+RIGHT, it is difficult to play like this.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't figure out setup
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought they were dead, so I returned them, but now I'm thinking that maybe I just didn't understand how to configure the inputs. I guess you have to go into control panel and devices to test them, then configure input in-game. Maybe I should try again.
customer_reviews.author: Honnis

customer_reviews.title: Durable and controls well
customer_reviews.text: Have had these setup now for about a year on a retro pi and works fantastic :) they have been very durable and used by our 4 year old a lot and have withstood his temper :)
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: It's a USB SNES Controller
customer_reviews.text: Using with a Raspberry Pi B2+ running RetroPie. Works great. The action on the D-Pad is a little loose. Moving your finger L/R ever so slightly while holding down will move L/R. Cord could be a little longer, but I knew what I was getting into so no marks off! Beauties for the price. No major complaints as of yet!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Selepack

customer_reviews.title: One quit working early on, but the other one has held up well.
customer_reviews.text: One of the controllers quit working after about two hours of gentle use, but the other one has held up after many hours of use. I'm not too upset because I really only needed one controller. They're really cheap so if I do need another controller, I'll probably buy this same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Dino

customer_reviews.title: It'd be nice if the cable was longer
customer_reviews.text: These work well with a RetroPie. It'd be nice if the cable was longer. I also had to take 1 controller apart and feed the cable through the anti-pull tabs so it wouldn't tear loose. Once fixed, both controllers do work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Silhanek

customer_reviews.title: Great SNES-style USB gamepad for Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use with Recalbox/EmulationStation on my Raspberry Pi and they work flawlessly. They also work great on a Windows PC. Feels just like my childhood - the muscle memory is still there. The cords are a little short tho, but I have a spare USB extension, so it's not a real problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas "DJ Phazer" Michálek

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for $15 but these aren't the best out there
customer_reviews.text: These controllers work, but they're not anywhere near OEM quality. Everything works, but nothing feels just right. As a casual gamer playing on a RetroPie, it's fine. I wouldn't give these a blanket recommendation, but in the realm of $15 for 2 controllers, they definitely hold their own.
customer_reviews.author: Shane O. Laake

customer_reviews.title: Plug & Play with raspberry Pi B+
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a xbox wired controller for my Pi set up but for certain games I wanted the old school feel to it. I saw these and thought i'd give it a try and they worked flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.author: Wing Tang

customer_reviews.title: Don't/Won't work
customer_reviews.text: I plugged them in and neither of them work. Everything I'm seeing says that they are plug and play, but these bad boys are just plug and lay there and do nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Toaster Bonanza

customer_reviews.title: I NEED ALL BUTTONS TO WORK, THEY DON'T!
customer_reviews.text: I JUST RECEIVED THESE TONIGHT AND I'M VERY disappointed THE X AND Y BUTTONS DON'T WORK ON EITHER OF THE REMOTES I HAVE TRIED EVERYTHING I BOUGHT THESE TO USE ON MY ANDROID TABLET WHICH HAS A USB PORT TO PLAY GAMES THROUGH A SIMULATOR....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Retro Game Time!
customer_reviews.text: These controllers feel just like my old SNES gamepads from back in the day. The buttons are responsive, the D-Pad actually works without sticking or missing commands, and there's plenty of cord length so you don't have to be right up against your computer to use them.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Older Model is Not Good, Newest Model Is Great
customer_reviews.text: D-Pad is horribly inconsistent. One can be pressing down and the controller will register it as a left or right click. Makes playing games super frustrating. Update: The company provides excellent customer service, and made sure to send me a pair of their new model: The newer model is much more responsive and tactile. If ordering, be sure to order the newest model!
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Would only recommend this if your budget is very low
customer_reviews.text: I just recently started using this product and I was very happy initially. Then after using it a couple of times, the controller kept disconnecting from the system. I found out it was the wire that caused the issue. The buttons felt good but since I couldn't use it, I have to give a lower rating. Also, the wire length is a little short.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... 4 player multi-tap on an emulator made for a great game night/dinner party
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me - 4 player multi-tap on an emulator made for a great game night/dinner party! If anyone happens to be looking - these are the multi-tap compatible games we played: - Battle Cross - Micro Machines - Pieces - Super Bomberman 2 & 3 - Fire Striker - Super Tetris - NBA Jam - Elite Soccer
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for SNES Games
customer_reviews.text: The guys at work have been going nuts over these. We have been playing all the classic fighting games. None of the buttons stick, we can still do all of the moves. It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Off Brand Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great for retro gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Got this with the raspberry pi kit to make an emulation station. The buttons work well and the controllers are ready to go right out of the box. It felt like I was back in 1994! Good price for 2 controllers so you can get to Street Fighter II and pummeling friends in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Rowhawdess

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for retro console
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for retro consoles, especially raspberry pie. Nothing hard about the set up. The cords are kind of short so if you think that you'll be sitting far from your TV or monitor, I'd suggest getting an extension cable.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy J.

customer_reviews.title: Not iBuffalo, but just about as good
customer_reviews.text: I got the controllers after their supposed update, and the quality is good. -Buttons are clicky and appropriately sensitive -D-pad isn't too soft or hard; just in the right spot. -Cord is long -All button presses are responsive and there are no ghost-presses -Controller is pretty light; I've thought about soldering some pennies in on either side to correct this, but it's a minor flaw at best. They're not iBuffalo, but these aren't all that bad, from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Izaak Xavier Mohling

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down for no reason
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the worst piece of electronic equipment....ever. I have had many many of these because o have returned them and replaced them, they work for a little while and then for no reason completely stop working. Most substandard hunks of junk ever!! Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris&Lara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mario
customer_reviews.text: I got these to run a Super Mario World ROM on an old Mac laptop. These worked just as expected and have allowed me to relive one of my favorite childhood games. I mean, you can't put a price on that - and so for only ~$10 it was a steal! The buttons are a bit loud so I annoy my wife when I play in bed.... But maybe the original NES button were somewhat loud too?
customer_reviews.author: GradStudent

customer_reviews.title: Fun but short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: These worked great right off the box, but did not last very long. It was a great way to introduce my kids to some of the old Sega and Nintendo classics from the 90's. Unfortunately - as the price may suggest - the quality is not great. I bought these less than a year ago, we probably played with them for a total of 12 to 15 hours, and some of the most used controls (front and back arrows) no longer respond. I tested them online to make sure the issue was not coming from the game/emulator itself, but the issue is definitely the game pads. Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: A good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest but they'll get the job done. I'm on day 2 with these controllers and have already had the down button get stuck, but that was easily corrected. Will update further down the road with more wear and tear
customer_reviews.author: Zaq

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: After learning of the defect in the controllers we received, the company contacted me very quickly and offered to provide a replacement completely free of charge or hassle. I've rarely had such great customer service, and the new controllers work like a charm. Just had a bit of bad luck the first time around. Original Review: They feel good and work well most of the time. I have a problem with one of them getting stuck scrolling uncontrollably through RetroPie menus until I unplug it and plug it back in, but they'll do for now while I decide on a nice set of wireless controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Zito Robinson

product_meta.title: 2 Pack SAFFUN SNES Retro USB Controller Gamepad Joystick, USB PC Super Classic Controller Joypad Gamestick for Windows PC MAC Linux Raspberry Pi 3 Sega Genesis Higan
product_meta.description:
Customers Frequently Asked Questions: 
Q: 1. What can of application do I need to download to use this controller?
A: No application needed. Plug it in and your PC or Respberry Pi will recognize it.
Q: 2. Work with steam games on pc?
A: No, not support steam games.
Q: 3. Will this work for Tesla Atari games?
A: If you're using an Atari emulator on PC or Mac, then it will.
Q: 4. Can I use it to play online games?
A: No, this controller not supports online games.
Q: 5. Why my controller inputting both joystick and keyboard buttons?
A: What emulator are you using? Difficulty on mapping the buttons depends on the emulator. We recommend using SNES9X on PC, OpenEmu on Apple Mac, Retropie on Respberry Pi.
Q: 6. After running a configuration through retroarch,when i connect the controller to my retropie/raspberry pi 2,the pi doesn't detect it.what's wrong?
A: You can try powering down and booting back up with the controllers connected. or rebuild retropie.
Q: 7. How long is the USB Cable?
A: Cord is approx. 5 ft. Long.
Q: 8. Can you configure the buttons to specific keys? I want to program buttons for shortcut commands like CTRL+Z, for example.
A: This can be accomplished with 3rd party software that maps joystick buttons to keyboard controls such as Xpadder, AutoHotKey, or EventGhost. 
Tips:
1. Plug in the controller first before open the emulator or power on the raspberry pi, so your device could detect the controller easily.
2. SNES9X is perfect emulator for Windows PC.
3. If you couldn't configure input correctly, please contact us and tell us your device and emulator, we could help to solve it.
Package :
2 x USB SNES Controllers
feature_bullets: ★ Generic USB controller, this uses a standard USB port, if your program or application accepts USB controller input, it can be used natively without drivers or patches, JUST PLUG AND PLAY! Cord is approx. 5 ft. Long. Super sensitive buttons for precision control. Third party controller, not original SNES / NES controller. But it works phenomenal with the Raspberry Pi game emulation and so on.

★ Supported Operating system: Windows 98, ME, Vista, 2000, 2003, XP, 7, 8, 8.1, 10; Linux UBUNTU, Linux Mint, Android Linux (via an USB OTG cable); Mac OS X and beyond; Retrogaming operating systems: RetroPie, Recalbox, Happi Game Center, Lakka, ChameleonPi, Piplay

★ Supported Device (With USB storage device): PC, Notebook Computer, Laptop Computer; MacBook; Android Smartphone: connect via an USB OTG cable; Raspberry Pi (RPI, Raspberry pie): Raspberry Pi 1 Model B, Model A, Raspberry Pi 1 Model B+, Raspberry Pi Zero, Raspberry Pi 2, Raspberry Pi 3 Model B, Raspberry Pi 3, Retro Pie. --- Note: NOT SUPPORT Android TV BOX.
★ Please Note: DO NOT SUPPORT ANDROID TV BOX, C64(Commodore 64), Google Chromebook, Amazon Fire TV, Steam, Tesla Model. Do not support ONLINE games

★ Supported Game Emulators: NES, SNES, Snes9x, ZSNES, Higan, Handheld GBA emulator, Sega Genesis emulator, Sega OpenEmu (Only support OS X), RetroArch (Works perfect on Android), BSNES (Perfect for two player action)…

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,089 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
